similar.title: Transplant programmes during COVID-19: Unintended consequences for health inequality.
text: Transplant programmes during COVID-19: Unintended consequences for health inequality.

Transplant programmes are being scaled back as healthcare systems worldwide respond to COVID-19. Most centres are now taking only super urgent and urgent cases, if at all. Management of donor organs is also impacted. Contingency protocols may prioritise distance over equitable sharing principles. Live and deceased donation is either being selectively paused or operating under stringent criteria based on local capacity. This will inevitably lead to variable patient experience.
abstract: Transplant programmes are being scaled back as healthcare systems worldwide respond to COVID-19. Most centres are now taking only super urgent and urgent cases, if at all. Management of donor organs is also impacted. Contingency protocols may prioritise distance over equitable sharing principles. Live and deceased donation is either being selectively paused or operating under stringent criteria based on local capacity. This will inevitably lead to variable patient experience.
